Comment: The Ruy Lopez, one of the most analyzed openings in history. Even in 1961, there were very few surprises left. But Geller has one prepared.

...Geller springs his surprise! 7...N-B3, 8 P-Q4 N-Q2 is the more solid "book" line. Geller throws caution to the winds and intends to try and smash Fischer's K-side quickly.
Fischer decides to counter sharply rather than relying on passive defense.
This sacrifices a Pawn in return for a quick attack.
